# Input

The National Survey of Family Growth conducted by the Centers for Disease Control gathers information on family life, marriage and divorce, pregnancy, infertility, use of contraception, and menâ€™s and womenâ€™s health. One of the variables collected on this survey is the age at first marriage. 5,534 randomly sampled US women between 2006 and 2010 completed the survey. The women sampled here had been married at least once. Do we have evidence that the mean age of first marriage for all US women from 2006 to 2010 is greater than 23 years? 

Data set you can find here: [link](https://aranaur.rbind.io/datasets/aa_test/first_marriage)

# Task

## Formulate a hypothesis

- Formulate the null and alternative hypothesis.
- Determine the level of significance

## Building visualizations (optional)

- Think about what visualizations you can build for this task to better present and interpret the results.

## Calculate statistics

- Calculate statistics for the selected test
- Calculate the p-value.
- Conclude rejecting or accepting the null hypothesis.

## Build a confidence interval

- Construct a 95% confidence interval for the mean.
